title: statsreportr
text: can install development version statsreportr GitHub :

title: statsreportr
text: examples functions statsreportr. examples outputing R console, intended used inline R Markdown Quarto document. used inline code R Markdown Quarto document, following inline code: results t test showed significant difference mpg 6 vs 8 cylinder cars (`r report_t(results4, effect = c("6", "8"), cohensd = cohensd4, cohens_magnitude = TRUE)`). render : results t test showed significant difference mpg 6 vs 8 cylinder cars (t(18.5) = 5.29, adjusted p < 0.0001, d = 2.23, indicating large effect).
code: library(statsreportr)  # ANOVAs results <- mtcars |>   rstatix::anova_test(mpg ~ cyl)  format_p(results$p) #> [1] "< 0.0001"  results2 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::anova_test(mpg ~ cyl * carb)  results3 <- aov(mpg ~ cyl * carb, data = mtcars)  report_anova(results2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 47.2, *p* < 0.0001, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.628" report_anova(results2, "carb") #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052" report_anova(results2, 2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052" report_anova(results3, 2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052"  # t-tests results3 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::t_test(mpg ~ am)  report_t(results3) #> [1] "*t*~(18.3)~ = -3.77, *p* = 0.00137"  results4 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::t_test(mpg ~ cyl)  cohensd4 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::cohens_d(mpg ~ cyl)  report_t(results4,   effect = c("6", "8"),   cohensd = cohensd4, cohens_magnitude = TRUE ) #> [1] "*t*~(18.5)~ = 5.29, adjusted *p* < 0.0001, *d* = 2.23, indicating a large effect"

title: statsreportr
text: following functions available package: format_p(): Format p-values readable. report_anova(): Report results ANOVA test. report_t(): Report results t-test.

what: Report Formated Statistical Tests In Rmd or qmd Documents
title: Report Formated Statistical Tests In Rmd or qmd Documents
text: goal statsreportr make easy report results statistical analyses inline code R Markdown Quarto document.

title: Report Formated Statistical Tests In Rmd or qmd Documents
text: can install development version statsreportr GitHub :

title: Report Formated Statistical Tests In Rmd or qmd Documents
text: basic examples shows generate reports ANOVAs t-tests: intent package used inline R Markdown Quarto document. example, following inline code: results t test showed significant difference mpg 6 vs 8 cylinder cars (`r report_t(results4, effect = c("6", "8"), cohensd = cohensd4, cohens_magnitude = TRUE)`). render : results t test showed significant difference mpg 6 vs 8 cylinder cars (t(18.5) = 5.29, adjusted p < 0.0001, d = 2.23, indicating large effect).
code: library(statsreportr)  # ANOVAs results <- mtcars |>   rstatix::anova_test(mpg ~ cyl)  format_p(results$p) #> [1] "< 0.0001"  results2 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::anova_test(mpg ~ cyl * carb)  results3 <- aov(mpg ~ cyl * carb, data = mtcars)  report_anova(results2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 47.2, *p* < 0.0001, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.628" report_anova(results2, "carb") #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052" report_anova(results2, 2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052" report_anova(results3, 2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052"  # t-tests results3 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::t_test(mpg ~ am)  report_t(results3) #> [1] "*t*~(18.3)~ = -3.77, *p* = 0.00137"  results4 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::t_test(mpg ~ cyl)  cohensd4 <- mtcars |>   rstatix::cohens_d(mpg ~ cyl)  report_t(results4,   effect = c("6", "8"),   cohensd = cohensd4, cohens_magnitude = TRUE ) #> [1] "*t*~(18.5)~ = 5.29, adjusted *p* < 0.0001, *d* = 2.23, indicating a large effect"

what: Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
title: Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
text: ANOVA rstatix::anova_test object stats::aov object effect name row number Effect report digits number digits round p value

title: Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
text: string formatted ANOVA result use inline R Markdown Quarto document

title: Report an ANOVA result in text — report_anova
code: library(rstatix) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘rstatix’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter  results <- anova_test(mtcars, mpg ~ cyl * carb)  report_anova(results) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 47.2, *p* < 0.0001, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.628" report_anova(results, effect = "cyl") #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 47.2, *p* < 0.0001, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.628" report_anova(results, effect = 2) #> [1] "*F*~(1,28)~ = 1.55, *p* = 0.223, $\\eta^2_G$ = 0.052"

what: Report a t test result in text — report_t
title: Report a t test result in text — report_t
Report a t test result in text — report_t
code: report_t(   ttest,   effect = 1,   digits = 3,   cohensd = NULL,   cohens_magnitude = FALSE )

title: Report a t test result in text — report_t
text: ttest rstatix::t_test object effect names row number effect report digits number digits round p value cohensd rstatix::cohens_d object include effect size report cohens_magnitude logical indicating effect size magnitude included report

title: Report a t test result in text — report_t
text: string formatted t test result use inline R Markdown Quarto document

title: Report a t test result in text — report_t
code: library(rstatix)  results <- t_test(mtcars, mpg ~ am)  report_t(results) #> [1] "*t*~(18.3)~ = -3.77, *p* = 0.00137"  results2 <- t_test(mtcars, mpg ~ cyl)  cohensd2 <- cohens_d(mtcars, mpg ~ cyl)  report_t(results2, cohensd = cohensd2, cohens_magnitude = TRUE) #> [1] "*t*~(13)~ = 4.72, adjusted *p* < 0.001, *d* = 2.07, indicating a large effect"  report_t(results2, effect = c("4", "6")) #> [1] "*t*~(13)~ = 4.72, adjusted *p* < 0.001"

title: statsreportr 0.0.0.9000
text: report_anova() report_t() added package. functions used report results ANOVA t-tests, respectively. designed used conjunction functions anova_test() t_test() ‘rstatix’ R package, used inline r code within R Markdown Quarto documents. report_anova() also works aov() objects running rstatix::anova_summary() object reporting results. format_p() added package. function used format p-values report-ready format. mainly used format p-values within report_*() functions, available use contexts well.
